poem:
**A Morning Surge**

Dollars leap, a brisk ballet—
crisp, leaping on a whim.
Retail taps the moment's vein,
stirring Wall Street's hymn.

The Dow breathes in, waltzes high,
Europe's heartbeats align.
All turmoil melts like frost
beneath this warming sign.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dollar jumps as strong US retail sales ease recession fears – business live 2.34pm BST Wall Street and European stock market indices rise after strong US retail sales Europe’s stock markets have regained all of the losses of the past fortnight, after the weaker-than-expected US non-farm payrolls caused days of turmoil. US stock markets have now also opened higher, boosted by the strength of retail sales. Here are the opening moves via Reuters: The Dow". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Dollar jumps as strong US retail sales ease recession fears – business live 2.34pm BST Wall Street and European stock market indices rise after strong US retail sales Europe’s stock markets have regained all of the losses of the past fortnight, after the weaker-than-expected US non-farm payrolls caused days of turmoil. US stock markets have now also opened higher, boosted by the strength of retail sales. Here are the opening moves via Reuters: The Dow
